senses.de: Prepared and expecting something to happen.
senses.ex: The athletes are ready for the competition.

Tips.title: Expressing Preparedness
Tips.description: Use 'be ready for' to indicate that someone is prepared for a future event or situation.
Tips.example: I'm ready for my exam tomorrow.

Tips.title: Expecting the Unexpected
Tips.description: Use 'be ready for anything' to suggest preparedness for all possibilities.
Tips.example: Pack a first-aid kit, you never know, be ready for anything.

Prepared.wordDefinition: 'Prepared' emphasizes the act of making oneself ready, while 'be ready for' emphasizes the state of being ready. 'Prepared' often suggests more thorough or deliberate preparation.

Set.wordDefinition: 'Set' implies readiness and preparedness, especially for a specific action.  'Be ready for' is more general and can encompass a wider range of situations.
